div2.entryFree:
1 naA^ava Eanohu * , aor.
naAa^a , (inf. n. naA^ovo, TA,) He became distant, or far removed, from him, or it. (K.) ― -b2- naA^ava, aor.
naAa^a , inf. n. naA^ovN He was slow, or tardy. (TA.) ― -b3- Also, inf. n. naA^ovN and manoA^avN, He walked, or went, syn. saEaY, (K,) at a slow pace. (TA.)
4 AnA^vhu * , inf. n. A_inoA=vN, He removed him, or it, far off; put him, or it, at a distance. (TA.)
sayorN manoA^vN * [so accord. to a marginal note in the L, in the handwriting of SM] A slow pace, or going, or journeying. (TA.)

niy^odiulN *
Calamity; incubus; nightmare: see Diy^obiulN.

1 nay^ifa *
He disliked, disapproved, or hated. (IAar, art. Anf.)
1 naA^aY bihi * [He, or it, removed him; put or placed him at a distance, away, or far away.] (S, art. TrH.) ― -b2- naA^aY He shrank from a thing: see an ex. in a verse cited voce daf~N.
4 A^anoA=hu * : see A=naAhu in art. AnY.
10 AisotanoA^aY * : i. q. AisotanaA'a q. v. in art. nwA^.

nuw^oYN *
A trench dug round a tent, (S, K,) or a barrier [raised] around it, (T, IB, TA,) to prevent the rain-water from entering it, (S,) or keep off a torrent. (K.)

4 A^anobaDa fY qawosihi *
He made the string of his bow to vibrate, that it might twang. (K.)

10 AisotanobaTa *
He drew forth, elicited, extracted, extorted: see 4 in art. xrj. See also Bd, and Jel, iv. 85. It may sometimes be rendered He excogitated.

1 nabaEa *
It (water) welled, or issued forth. ― -b2- nabaEa Ealayohimo: see nabaA^a Elyhm.

4 A^anobaEa *
He (God) made, or caused, water to issue. (Msb.)

naboEN *
The tree so-called: see an ex. of its n. un. in a verse cited voce taHaw~afa and taxaw~afa. ― -b2- naboEN: see $awoHaTN and $iroyaAnN and fatoHN. ― -b3- naboEaAni The two shafts of a cart: so called because they were commonly made of wood of the tree called naboE: see raAd~apN.
AnobaEu * , irregularly formed from the augmented verb A^anobaEa: see an ex. in a couplet cited voce saqaY.
nbq mn AlTryq * and AnbAq denote nearness and shortness in a way (TA, art. Ejl), like musotaEojilapN.

nabiqN * , properly the fruit of the sidor or lote-tree, is also applied to The tree called sidor itself: see dawomN. The fruit so called is a drupe, resembling the crab. ― -b2- It seems to be also applied to A drupe absolutely, or a drupe like that of the sidor: see its dim., ↓ nubayoqapN voce A^a$okalu: see also $iroyaAnN.
nbyq * [app. nubayoqN] A bad sort of dates, also called HuboyaqN. (TA in art. Hbq.) ― -b2- See nabiqN.
nabiyqapN * of a grape-vine, A zamaEap when it has grown large. (ISh in TA, art. zmE.)

nabolN *
Arrows: (M:) or Arabian arrows: (T, S, Mgh, Msb, K:) for the sing. they say sahomN. (T.)

nubolN *
Sharpness, acuteness, or sagacity; syn. *akaA='N: and generosity, or nobility; syn. najaAbapN. (K.) ― -b2- nubolN Excellence; (T, M;) syn. najaAbapN; and also *akaA='N. (M.) [Ex.],
kafaY Almaro'a nubalFA A^ano tuEad~a maEaAyibuho
(MF, art. Hbr.)

1 maA nabiha lahu *
He did not know it; or know, or have knowledge, of it; was not cognizant of it; or did not understand it. (K.) ― -b2- nabiha lilA^amori His attention became roused to the thing, or affair, after he had forgotten it. (AZ, S.) ― -b3- maA nabihotu lahu: see maA A^abihotu lahu. ― -b4- nabaha Ealayohimo: see nabaA^a Ealayhm. ― -b5- nabuha He was, or became, eminent, celebrated, or well known. (S, K, * TA.)

2 nab~ahahu EalaY Al$~aYo'i *
He made him acquainted with the thing; informed him of it; gave him notice of it; notified it to him. (S.) ― -b2- nab~ahahu liloA^amori (tropical:) [He roused his attention to the thing, or affair]. (TA in art. yqZ.) ― -b3- nab~ahahu (tropical:) [He roused him from heedlessness or inadvertence: he roused his attention. (TA.)

5 tanab~aha EalaY Al$~aYo'i *
He became acquainted with the thing; became informed of it; had notice of it. (S.) ― -b2- tanab~aha lialoA^amori (tropical:) [His attention became roused, or he had his attention roused, to the thing, or affair]. (Msb and TA in art. yqZ.) ― -b3- tanab~aha (tropical:) He became vigilant, wary, or cautious. (Msb, TA.) ― -b4- tanab~aha and ↓ Ainotabaha (tropical:) He became roused from heedlessness or inadvertence; his attention became roused; or he had his attention roused. (TA.)
8 A_inotabaha see 5.

nabiyhN *
Eminent, celebrated, or well known; (S, K, * TA;) contr. of xaAmilN. (S, TA.)

kalimapu tanobiyhK *
A word used to give notice, to a person addressed, of something about to be said to him. (TA, voce haA.) See also haA termed tanobiyhN. It may generally be rendered Now.

1 nabaAa Eani AlD~ariybapi *
It (a sword) recoiled, or reverted, [or glanced off, or away,] from the thing struck with it, without penetrating, or without effect; (TA;) returned from it without cutting; (Msb;) took no effect upon it; (S;) syn. kal~a. (K.) ― -b2- nabaAa It (the edge of a sword) would not cut; was blunt. (TA.) ― -b3- nabaAa Eani Al$~aYo'i It (the sight) recoiled, or reverted, from the thing; was repelled by it; (S, * K, * TA;) syn. tajaAfaY (TA) and kl~. (K.) ― -b4- nabaA Eani Al$~aYo'i It (nature) recoiled, flinched, shrank, or was averse, from the thing, or shunned it, and would not accept it. (Msb.) ― -b5- nabaA janobuhu Eani AlfiraA$i (tropical:) His side did not rest, or was restless, or uneasy, upon the bed: (K, TA:) it shrank from it. ― -b6- nabaA It (a saddle) was unfirm, or unsteady; not firm, or steady, in its place. (TA.)
nabiY~N * : see a verse voce ratomN.
nabiy~apN * , A thing like the suforap, q. v., made of palm-leaves, upon which flour or meal is sifted. (I'Abbád, O, K.)
nutuwEN * The gums of trees; correctly nutuwHN.
natonFA lahu * and waA natonaAhu Fye or shame on him or it! See dafozN.
minotinN * , originally munotinN or minotiynN: see manojizN.

1 navalN *
He cleansed an intestine: see muboEarN.

navuwlN *
A lean, or emaciated, woman. (IAar, TA, art. jml.)
naviylN * The dust, or earth, of the foundations of a house. (TA, art. vwb.)

naviylapu biy^orK *
The earth that is around a well, that is seen from afar. (S, art. jbw.)
1 navuwt Eanohu xabarFA * and navayot : see rvY.
6 tanaAvayonaAhu * : see rvY
A^anovaY * : see A^avonaY.

1 najaEa fiyhi *
It (a discourse, S, K: and exhortation, S, Msb, K; and medicine, S, Msb; and fodder, Msb) entered into him, and produced an effect upon him: (S, K:) or showed its effect [upon him]. (Msb.) ― -b2- It (medicine) benefited him; as also ↓ A^anojaEa and ↓ naj~aEa. (TA.) [And It (eating) had an agreeable, a wholesome, or a beneficial, effect upon him: so I have rendered it voce EanaY.] ― -b3- naj~aEa said of food and of beverage, inf. n. nujuwEN, It was wholesome, or] suitable, or it agreed. (So accord. to an expl. of the inf. n. in the KL.)
2 naj~aEa see 1.
4 A^anojaEa see 1.

8 AinotajaEa *
He sought after herbage (S, Mgh, K) in its place: (S, K:) or went to seek after herbage in its place. (Msb.) And AntjE baladFA [He sought after herbage in a district, or country]. (K in art. Hnk.)
nijaEN * for nujaEN: see rijoEapN.
nujoEapN * The seeking after herbage (S, Mgh, K) in its place; (S, K;) the going to seek after herbage in its place. (Msb.)

najiyEN *
Effused blood: see 2 in art. xwD.
manojaEN * , pl. manaAjiEu A desert: see baAdiyapN.

munotajaEN *
A place where herbage is sought: see maHoDarN.
nijaAfN * of a door, i. q. darowanod [a Persian word, A bolt, or bar.] (IAar in L, art. rtj.)

TaEonapN najolaA='u *
A wide wound with a spear or the like. (TA.) See an ex. in a verse cited voce rub~a. ― -b2- EayonN najolaA='u A wide eye; pl. EuyuwnN nujolN. (TA.) See a verse in art. frg (conj. 4).

minojalN *
A reaping-hook. (Mgh; and S, K, voce miHoSadN.) It has a toothed, or serrated, edge: (A, art. Hz; and K, art. A$r:) and is sometimes plain. (K, voce miHa$~N, and M and L, voce sin~N.) See mixolabN and darahorahapN. ― -b2- [A reaping-hook: or a pruning-hook: sometimes signifying the latter:] an iron implement, having teeth, with which seed-produce is cut: or one with which the wood, or branch, is cut off from the tree, and cast down, or away. (TA.)
najylN * : see TaHomaA='u.

4 A^anojama *
It (rain, &c.) left off. (K.)

najomN * [A star. ― -b2- Also, An asterism, or constellation: being applied autonomastically to] the Pleiades. (S.) ― -b3- nujuwmN [like EiroqN] signifies also The sprouts from the roots [of a tree, or shrub], before the rabiyE [meaning either spring or autumn], the heads of which one sees like large needles, clearing the ground. (TA.) See EusoluwjN. ― -b4- najomN also signifies (tropical:) The time when a payment falls due. (Msb.) [Hence, app., an ex. cited voce TY~N.] ― -b5- And hence, (Msb,) (tropical:) An instalment: syn. waZiyfapN. (Mgh, Msb.) See also EazolN. ― -b6- najomN and najomapN A kind of plant, triticum repens or dogs' grass: see viylN.
minojamN * The beam of a balance; (MA;) the transverse piece of iron, in which is the tongue, of a balance. (S, K.) See Eamuwdu AlmiyzaAni.

1 najaA *
Alvum dejecit; (Msb, TA;) ventumve per anum emisit: (TA:) he voided his ordure; or broke wind. ― -b2- najaA, inf. n. najaA='N, He was quick, or swift, and outstripped. (S.) See an ex. of the inf. n., voce gwlN. ― -b3- najaA He became safe, or secure; he escaped. (Msb, &c.)
2 naj~awa see 4.
4 A^anojaAhu * and ↓ naj~aAhu He saved, him; rescued him; preserved him. (K.)

10 AisotanojaY *
He washed, or wiped with a stone or a piece of dry clay, the place [of exit] of his excrement. (Msb.) -A2- AisotanojawoA: see 8 in art. sEr.
najowN * and najaA='N A shower of rain. ― -b2- See $uwobuwbN and 1. ― -b3- njA' A well of which the water is distant [from the mouth]. (O, TA, voce qarabN.)

najowapN *
An elevated piece of land. (Msb.)
najiY~N * : see najowaY. ― -b2- EuroyaAnu Aln~ajiY~i: see art. ErY.

najowaY *
Secret discourse between two persons or parties. (TA.) ― -b2- A secret between two persons or parties; as also ↓ najiY~N. (K, TA.) ― -b3- A person, or persons, discoursing secretly, or telling secrets one with another. (TA.)
manojaApN * [A cause, or means, of safety: of the measure mafoEalapN, originally manojawapN; similar to mafolaHapN, &c.]. (S.)
najayotu * a dial. var. of najawotu: see dawokapN.
1 naHaza * : see an ex. in a verse cited voce EaAsijN.
naAHizN * : see naAkitN.

minoHaAzN *
A mortar; syn. haAwuwnN. (K.)
5 tanaH~asa see 10.
10 AisotanoHasotuhu Eano ka*aA * and ↓ tanaH~asotuhu: see 10 in art. snH.

naHiyfN *
Slender, slim, thin, spare, lean, or light of flesh.

1 naHiala jisomuhu *
His body became lean, or emaciated. (S.)

niHolapN *
i. q. fariyDapN; or diyaAnapN; and diynN, as in the saying maA niHolatuka [What is thy religion?]. (TA.)
1 naHama * , said of a horse, seems to be best rendered He breathed pantingly, or hard, with a sound from the chest. See 1 in art. DbH.
naHiymN * signifies A sound (Sawot) from the chest of the horse. (TA.)

1 naHaA naHowahu *
He went towards, or in the direction of, him or it. (Msb, TA.) ― -b2- Also, He pursued his (another's) course, doing as he did; or purposed his purpose. ― -b3- See EaraDa EaroDahu, and $adaA $adowahu; and see qaSodahu. ― -b4- naHaAhu, inf. n. naHowN, signifies [also] He purposed it, or intended it. (MA.) ― -b5- naHawotu jiloda AlbaEiyri, and ↓ A^anoHayatuhu, I stripped off the skin of the camel. (Msb, voce salaxa). See 4.

2 naH~aY *
He put a thing aside, or away, or apart; (Msb;) removed it from its place, (Msb, K, TA,) placed it at a distance. (TA.) ― -b2- He made a person to turn away, or withdraw, or retire, from (Eano) an affair. ― -b3- naH~aY Eanohu Al$~aYo'a He put aside, or away, or he warded off, or removed, from him the thing. See 4.

4 A^anoHaY Ealayohi * [He leant, bore, or pressed, upon him, or it, with his body, hand, &c.:] i. q. AiEotamada; as also ↓ naHaA. (IAar, TA.) ― -b2- A^anoHaY EalaY fulaAnK biAls~awoTi [He attacked such a one with the whip], and biAls~ayofi [with the sword]: and hence biAlt~aEoniyfi (tropical:) he accosted him with harsh, or rough, behaviour; syn. A^aqobala Ealayohi. (Har, p. 508.) ― -b3- A^anoHaY EalaY Al$~aYo'i bijamiyEi kaf~ihi [He seized the thing with his whole hand]. (M, voce qabaDa [q. v.]). ― -b4- A^anoHayotu EalaY Haloqihi Als~ik~iyna I applied the knife to, or put it across, his throat, or fauces; syn. EaraDotuhu: and in like manner you say, nHY Elyh b$frth [but whether by this be meant naH~aY or naHaA is doubtful. (TA.) ― -b5- See 1.

5 tanaH~aY *
He, or it, removed; withdrew; went, or moved, away, or aside; (Msb;) or retired to a distance. (TA.) ― -b2- tanaH~aY (TA, art. qEr,) signifies tkl~f An ytkl~m klAmFA naHowiy~FA, i. e. tkl~f Altkl~m ElY Tryq AlnHAp. (IbrD.)

8 AinotaHaY *
It fell, like a man's hand when he strikes with it upon his other hand; (L, TA, in art. trH:) and, in prostration, he fell with his forehead to the ground, and rested upon his forehead, not upon the palms of his hands: mentioned by Sh, from 'Abd-Es-Samad Ibn- Hassán, on the authority of some of the Arabs: so says Az. (L and TA in that art.)

naHowN * The like of a thing: syn. mivolN. (TA.) ― -b2- Quantity, &c.; syn. miqodaArN. (TA.) ― -b3- A division, &c.; syn. qisomN. (TA.) ― -b4- naHowahu: see naHaA. ― -b5- naHowu Alv~alaAvapi About three. fiY naHowi valaAvi saAEaAtK In about three hours. ― -b6- Earafotuhu fiY naHowi kalaAmihi and fY laHoni klAmh and fY miEoraADi klAmh signify the same. (Msb in art. ErD.) See the last of these, voce EaruwDN. ― -b7- Ait~ay^ido EalaY naHowika, i. e. A^aw~ino EalaY qadorika [or miqodaArika]: see art. Awn.
naHoYN * : see niHoY.

niHoYN *
A skin for holding liquids: (K:) or for clarified butter: (S, Msb, K:) as also ↓ naHoYN, (K.)
$adiydu Aln~aAHiyapi * (assumed tropical:) A hardy man. (TA, art. ErD.)
*aAtu Aln~iHoyayoni * . Respecting what is said of the woman thus named, and of xaw~aAt, in the S, see $rd.

mutanaj~K *
Going, or being, away from (Eano) a place, person, or thing. ― -b2- mutanaH~FY [A place to which to turn away, or back, from a thing; or to which one removes, withdraws, or retires afar off]. (K, voce manokaSN.) See manokaSN and maHorifN.

naAHiyapN *
i. q. jaAnibN q. v., A side; a lateral, or an outward, or adjacent, part or portion. (K, &c.) ― -b2- An apartment of a house. (Mgh, voce Hay~izN.) And the pl., nawaAHK, The outer parts or regions of an animal. The sing. may often be rendered A part, or portion, of a place. ― -b3- naAHiyapN is of the measure faAEilapN in the sense of the measure mafoEuwlapN, [meaning manoHuw~apN, a part, or the like, or a point, towards which one goes, or directs himself; a point of direction;] because one goes, or directs himself, towards it: (Msb:) best rendered as above; adding, or part, region, district, quarter, or tract, considered with respect to its collocation or juxtaposition or direction, or considered as belonging to a whole: a vicinage, or neighbourhood: and a part of a country, a region, district, quarter, or tract, absolutely; a district; a province: often best rendered a side; or a region, district, quarter, or tract: or a part of a place, an apartment: see Hay~izN, in art. Hwz. ― -b4- Also A limit, bound, or boundary: see two tropical exs. of its pl. (nawaAHK) voce HinowN, and another in a verse voce rasuwlN: or a remote side; syn. jaAnibN mutanaH~K: (Kz, in TA:) a tract of land. (KL.) See A^ufuqN and jaAnibN. ― -b5- EalaY naAHiyapK Beside, aside, or apart; like ElY jaAnibK and EalY TarafK; and so naAHiyapF and fiY naAHiyapK, &c.: you say jalasa fiY naAHiyapK minohumo He sat aside, or apart, from them: and A^anaA fiY nawaAHK mino h`*aA AlA^amori, expl. voce $afaqN. And fiY naAHiyapi ka*aA In the direction of such a thing: see A^a$oraY. ― -b6- huwa EalaY naAHiyatihi He is keeping to his own side, following his own course: see jadiy~apN.

nuxaAEN * The spinal cord, or spinal marrow; (S, K, &c.;) what extends from the haAmap through (fiY) the vertebræ to the end of the *anab, like a cord of marrow. (Zj in his “ Khalk el-Insán. ”) See also $aliylN and AlbixaAEu.
A^anoxaEN * : see A^axonaEu.

nixaAfN *
A boot: (IAar, K, TA:) or a boot much patched. (Az, TA.)
1 naxVla see 8.
5 tanax~ala see 8.

8 Ainonaxalahu *
He cleared it [or sifted it]; as also
↓ naxalahu and ↓ tanax~alahu: (K [see safosafahu]:) or he took the best of it (S, Msb) to the utmost: (S:) or he chose the best of it for himself. (TA.)

naxoliY~N *
A cultivator of palm-trees: see EaTalN.
1 nuxiYa bika*aA * : He boasted of such a thing: see zuhiYa bika*aA.

naxowapN *
Pride; self-magnification; haughtiness. (S, Msb, K.)

5 tanad~asa Eani AlA^aHobaAri *
He sought to learn the news privily: see taHad~asa and taHas~asa.

rimaAHN nawaAdisu *
Piercing spurs: see a verse of El-Kumeyt cited voce gaArapN, in art. gwr.

1 nadafa * [He separated and loosened cotton by means of a bow and a kind of wooden mallet, by striking the string of the bow with the mallet: see Halaja; and Harana] he beat cotton with the ↓ minodaf, (S, Msb, * K,) also called ↓ minodafap, i. e., his wooden implement with which he strikes the bowstring, that it [the cotton] might become fine. (K.)
minodafN * and minodafapN: see 1; and see miHoranN and minobaDN.

5 tanad~ala *
He bound a dasotaAr [or minodiyl i. e. napkin or the like] upon his head. (KL.) And biminodiylK ↓ tamanodala He bound a mndyl upon his head. (Mgh.)

Q. Q. 2 tamanodala biraAy^iTapK *
He used a rAy^Tp [or ryoTap] as a minodiyl. (TA in art. ryT from a trad.) ― -b2- See 5.
minodalN * app., Hard steel (*akarN SulobN, not penis rigens). (K.) See *akarN.

1 nadima EalaY maA faEala *
He grieved for what he had done; regretted it; repented of it: or he disliked it. (Msb.)

nadiymN *
A companion in drinking; a cup-companion. (S, Msb, K.) And hence, Any convivial companion; a boon-companion.

manodamN *
Repentance: an inf. n. of nadima; see an ex. in a verse of El-Kattál El-Kilábee, cited voce A^aY~N.

1 nadiYa *
It was, or became, moist, or moistened. (S, K.) ― -b2- maA nadiyaniY minohu $aYo'N, (M,) or maA nadiyaniY minohu $aYo'N A^akorahuhu, (T,) [A thing, or a thing that I dislike,] did not betide me or befall me [from him]. (T, M.) And laA yanodaAka min~iY $aYo'N takorahuhu [A thing that thou dislikest] shall not befall thee [from me]. (M.) maA nadiyato kaf~iY lahu bi$ar~K [My hand did not evil to him]: and maA nadiytu bi$aYo'K takorahuhu [I did not a thing that thou dislikest]. (T.) See also art. Erq, first par., last sentence but two. ― -b3- saA^alotuhu falamo yanoda liY bi$aYo'K [I asked him, and he did not to me, or for me, anything]. (TA, in art Enw.) ― -b4- maA tanodaY SafaAtuhu i. q. maA yabiD~u Hajaruhu, q. v. (S, art. bD.) See also art. Sfw.
2 nad~aYa see 5.

3 naAdaY Ealayohi * [He made proclamation of him] (S, A, Msb) biA@loA_ifolaAsi (A) or A^an~ahu A^afolas (S) or biA^an~ahu SaAra mufolisFA (Msb) [that he had become bankrupt, or insolvent]. ― -b2- [naAdaY bh He proclaimed it; made proclamation of it: a very common signification, but one which I have not found in any Lex.] ― -b3- You say also naAdiY fiY Aln~aAsi, meaning taA^a*~ana and tqad~ama and A^aEolama. (S in art. A*n. See A=*anahu].) ― -b4- wanuwduwA A^ano tilokumu Aljan~apu: (Kur vii. 41:) see A^ano as a contraction of A^an~a. ― -b5- naAdaAhu turaAbuhu: see nbA^th AlArD. ― -b6- naAdaAhu He called him; called to him; summoned him, or hailed him: (S, Msb:) or, (T, M,) and nAdY bihi, (M,) he called out to him (T, M) with the loudest voice. (T.)
5 tanad~aY * [quasi pass. of ↓ nad~aY, It was moistened, by dew, or the like: or] i. q. nadiYa [it was, or became, moist]: said of a place [&c.]: and i. q. naraw~aY. (TA.)

nidaA='N * signifies simply The raising the voice; not implying the expression of meaning by speech. (Er-Rághib, TA.) ― -b2- Harofu nidaA='i A particle of calling, or hailing, or invocation; as yaA. ― -b3- A vocative particle. ― -b4- The vocative form of speech. ― -b5- Also, agreeably with many other instances, like xaloqN in the sense of maxoluwqN, an inf. n. used in the sense of a pass. part. n., meaning A person or thing called; the object of a vocative particle, syn. with ↓ munaAdFY.

nadFY * , originally, Rain: (Msb: [but generally it seems to signify dew, absolutely; or day-dew.] See a tropical usage in a verse of El-Kumeyt cited voce riqobapN. ― -b2- nadFY Bounty; liberality: (S, M:) a gift. (T.) ― -b3- nadFY Moisture (S, K) of the earth; as also ↓ nadaAwapN. (S.) ― -b4- nadFY is generally thus written: not nadFA.

nadiY~N *
An assembly: see a verse cited voce $arafN.
nadaAwapN * and nuduw~apN Moisture. (Msb.) See nadFY.
munaAdFY * : see nidaA'N.

daAb~apN narojisiy~apN *
A beast of carriage whose whiteness inclines to yellowness [like the narcissus]. (TA, art. qrTs.)

nirosiyaAnapN *
A species of dates. (S, in art. rsw.)

1 nazaEa A_ilaY A^aholihi * , (S, K,) aor.
naziEa , (S,) inf. n. nizaAEN (S, K) and nuzuwEN and nazaAEpN; (K:) and ↓ naAzaEa; (K;) He yearned towards or for, longed for, or desired, his family. (S, * K, * TA, PS). ― -b2- nazaEotu A_ilayohi inf. n. nizaAEN, I yearned towards, longed for, or desired, him or it; syn. xanafotu The feh is unclear in the text.. (Ham, p. 429.) See an ex. voce xafoDN. ― -b3- Hence. nazaEa biY A_ilayohi It (desire) invited me to it. (Har, p. 606.) ― -b4- nazaEa A_ilayohi He inclined to it. (Har, p. 234.) ― -b5- nazaEa A_ilaY EiroqK kariymK [He inclined to a noble radical, or ancestral, or hereditary quality: and in like manner, lay^iymK]: and nazaEa A_ilaY A^aEoraAqihi and nazaEahaA [he inclined to his radical, or ancestral, or hereditary, qualities]: and A^aEoraAquhu nazaEoto bihi [his radical, or ancestral, or hereditary, qualities inclined him]. (L, in TA.) ― -b6- nazaE It inclined by likeness. (Msb.) ― -b7- nazaEa A_ilaY A^abiyhi (S, Msb, K,) fY Al$~abaha (S,) and nazaEa A^ayaAhu, (K,) He resembled his father: (Msb, K:) or inclined to his father in likeness; syn. *ahaba (S:) or he took after his father; had a natural likeness to him. ― -b8- nuzuwEN signifies Yearning; and natural inclining. -A2- nazaEa and ↓ AinotazaEa He pulled, plucked, or drew, out, or up, or off; removed from his or its place; displaced. (S, Msb, K.) ― -b2- nazaEa vawobahu, (Mgh, in art. xlE,) and naEolahu, (Mgh and Msb in that art.,) He pulled off his garment, and his sandal. See, however, xalaEa.
― -b3- nazaEa (Msb, TA,) aor.
naziEa , (TA,) inf. n. nazoEN (Msb, TA,) He was at the point [or in the agony] of death; meaning, of having his soul drawn forth: (Msb:) he gave up his spirit; as also ↓ naAzaEa, inf. n. nizaAEN. (TA.) ― -b4- nazaEa fiY Alquwosi He drew the bow; (S, Msb, K;) i. e., its string; or he drew, or pulled, the string of the bow with the arrow. (TA.) -A3- tanoziEuhu $aEarapN bayoDaA='u, relating to a horse: see A^asofaY.

3 naAzaEahu AlHabola *
He contended with him in pulling the rope; syn. jaA*abahu A_iy~aAhu. Hence, nAzEh fY ka*aA (tropical:) He contended, disputed, or litigated, with him, respecting such a thing. (Mgh.) ― -b2- naAzaEahu AlkalaAma (tropical:) He disputed with him in, or respecting, words. (TA.) ― -b3- naAzaEatoniY nafosiY A_ilaY hawAhaA, inf. n. nizaAEo, My soul strove with me to incline me to love her. (TA.) See 1.

6 tanaAzaEonaA AlHadiyva *
We discoursed together; one with another. (TA, art. hSr.) ― -b2- tanaAzaEuwA Al~ajaza bayonahumo (K, art. rjz,) They recited verses, or poetry, of the metre termed rajaz one with another; as also taEaATawohu. (TK, art. rjz.) ― -b3- tanaAzaEN The contending in altercation, disputing, or litigating, one with another: (K:) or tanaAzaEuwA they disagreed, one with another; held different ways or opinions. (Msb.)
8 A_inotazaEa See 1. ― -b2- AinotazaEa minohu Haq~ahu He wrested from him his right, or due. ― -b3- AinotazaEa Hadiyvahu: see AiqtDb.

nazaEN *
Baldness on each side of the forehead: see jalaHN; and gamamN.

nazoEapN *
A baldness in the side of the forehead. See SadomapN.
biy^orN nazuwEN * [A deep well] i. q. jarowrN. (A, voce jarowrN.)
nuz~aEN * is pl. of naAziEN; as is also nuzuEN. (TA.) See an ex. in a verse cited bAbN.

naz~aAEN *
Dragging much, or forcibly: see Kur, lxx. 16. ― -b2- AlEroqu naz~aAEN (see Freytag's Arab. Prov., ii. 168) is probably similar to AlEiroqu ds~aAsN, and means The radical, or ancestral, or hereditary, quality is wont to return to its usual possessor: or it may mean, is wont to draw.
A^anozaEu * : see A^ajolaHu.
manozaEu biy^orK * [The bottom of a well; the place from which the water is drawn]. (TA, art. mtH.)

1 nazafa *
He entirely exhausted (S, Msb, K) a well, (Msb,) or the water of a well. (S, K.)

manozuwfN *
Exhausted: see an ex. voce DaraTa.

nazaqN *
Lightness, and unsteadiness, or lightwittedness, (S, Msb, K,) on an occasion of anger; (K;) i. q. sarobaxapN; lightness in any work, or action: hastiness, with foolishness or ignorance: (JK, TA:) hastiness, or sharpness, of temper; irascibility; passionateness: a meaning deduced from various examples, and confirmed by present usage.

naziqN *
Light, and unsteady, or lightwitted. (Msb.) See also nazaqN: and see $uHo*uw*N.
naziqapN * and ↓ nizaAqN A refractory she-camel; hard to be managed. (Msb.)
nizaAqN * : see naziqapN.
All~abuw^apu A^anozaqu mina AlA^asadi * [The lioness is more impetuous than the lion]. (S, voce sabuEapN.)

nizokN * The penis (*akar, S, K, i. e. qaDiyb, TA) of the Dab~ (S, K) and of the waral: (K: [in the CK, wAlwarku is erroneously put for wAlwarali:) accord. to the assertion of the Arabs, (S,) it (S, K,) the former, (S,) as also the Hiro*awon, (Msb voce Hr*wn,) has two penes (nizokaAni); (S, K, TA;) and the female has quronataAni, i. e. [two wombs] raHimaAni. (TA.)

1 nazala biAlmakaAni * (Kull) and nazala AlmakaAna (Msb in art. Hl, &c.) He alighted, descended and stopped or sojourned or abode or lodged or settled, in the place; syn. Hal~a fiyhi. (Kull.) See Hal~a. ― -b2- nazala labanu Al$~aApi [The milk of the ewe descended into her udder; i. e. she secreted milk]. (S, K, voce A^aDoraEato.) ― -b3- nazala manozila ka*aA It took, or occupied, the place, or became in the position or condition, of such a thing: see a verse cited voce A^ano, near the end of the paragraph; and another voce HabiybN; and see manozilapN. ― -b4- nazalotu, AlwadiYa, for fiY AlwaAdiY: see daxalotu Albayata in art. dxl.

3 naAzalahu *
He alighted with him, each to oppose the other, in war, or battle; inf. n. munaAzalapN and nizaAlN. (Msb.) ― -b2- naAzalahu He alighted with him.

4 A^anozalato *
Her (a camel's) milk descended [into her udder]: opposed to A^aqolaSato. (TA, art. qlS.) ― -b2- A^anozalati All~abana [i. e. All~ibaA^a She (a camel) excerned the first milk, or biestings, into her udder; i. q. A^abosaqato. (TA in art. bzq.) ― -b3- She excerned milk [either into, or from, the udder]. ― -b4- A^anozalati AlnAqpu All~abana mina AlD~aroEi [or fiY AlDrE] The she-camel excerned the milk from [or into] the udder. (TA, art. *rA^.) ― -b5- A^anozalahu He lodged him; made him his guest; or gave him refuge or asylum; syn. A=waAhu; (S and K in art. AwY;) and A^aDaAfahu and Day~afahu: (Mgh in art. Dyf:) [and he lodged and entertained him;] namely, a guest. (Msb.) I. q. A^avowaAhu manozilaFA. (Fr in T in art. bwA^.) ― -b6- A^anozalahu Eano ka*aA He made him to resign, or relinquish, such a thing. ― -b7- A^anozalotu bika HaAjatiY [app. I imposed my want upon thee]. (S in art. Er.) And A^anozala HaAjatahu ElY krym. (TA.)

6 tanaAzala *
He descended gradually, by little and little. ― -b2- tnAzl A_ilaY A^aHadK He humbled himself, condescended, to one. ― -b3- tnAzl Eani Almuloki He abdicated the kingdom. ― -b4- tnAzl Ean $aYo'K He desisted from a thing. ― -b5- tanaAzaluwA They alighted and ate by turns with different people; i. q. tanaAwabuwA, q. v.

10 Aisotanozalahu *
He made him, or caused him, or it, to descend. (Msb.) ― -b2- Aisotanozalahu Eano raA^ayihi [He sought to make him resign, or relinquish, his opinion]. (Bd, xii. 11.)

nuzolN *
Food or rations at a halt: see sukonN, in two places.

nuzulN *
Food prepared for the guest. (Msb.) See mafav~apN.)
A^aroDN nazilapN * : see Ha$aAdN.

naziylN *
A guest. (S, Mgh, Msb, * K.) See also Har, 353.
naAzilN * [Alighting, &c.,] has for pl. nuzuwlN and nuz~aAlN. (TA.)

naAzilapN *
A defluxion: pl. nawAzilu. See sil~N. ― -b2- naAzilapN A severe calamity or affliction, (S, Msb, K,) that befalls men. (S, Msb.)

manozilN *
A place of alighting or descending and stopping or sojourning or abiding or lodging or settling: (Mgh:) a place of settlement: an abode; a dwelling; a place where travellers alight in the desert; syn. manohalN: a [house, or mansion, such as is called] daArN: (S, K:) or, accord. to the fuqahaA=', less than a dAr, and more than a bayot [or chamber], consisting of at least
two chambers (bayotaAni) or three. (Mgh.) See also bayotN.

manozilapN *
A space which one traverses in journeying. (TA, art. syr.) ― -b2- manozilapN, used unrestrictedly, Station, standing, footing, or grade; honourable station or rank; a place of preferment. ― -b3- A predicament in which one stands. ― -b4- kalimapN bimanozilapi kalimapK A^uxoraY A word equivalent, or similar, to another word. ― -b5- [You say] yusotaEomalu bimanozilapi ka*aA It (a word) is used in the manner of such [another word]; generally with respect to government, not necessarily with respect to meaning. (The lexicons passim.) ― -b6- Aln~aAzilu mina Ald~iyni wAld~unoyaA manozilapa Aln~uwri mina AlEayoni Who is, in respect to religion and the world, as light to the eye.
maroEFY munozilN * : see musokinN.

2 naz~aha A@ll~`h *
He declared God to be far removed, or free, from every impurity or imperfection, or from everything derogatory from his glory; like sab~aHahu and qad~asahu. ― -b2- tanoziyhu A@ll~`hi is The declaring God to be far removed, or free, [from every imperfection or impurity, or from everything derogatory from his glory; i. e.,] from evil [of every kind]; or from the having anything like unto Him by participation of his essence or otherwise, and from defects that may not be imputed to Him. (TA.)

5 tanaz~aha Eani AlA^aqo*aAri *
He shunned, avoided, or kept or removed himself far from, unclean things; (S, * Mgh, Msb;) preserved himself therefrom. (Mgh.) ― -b2- tanaz~aha, used absolutely, and said of a man, means He shunned, avoided, or kept or removed himself far from, unclean things; kept aloof from, &c.; or from things occasioning blame. (TA.) ― -b3- tanaz~aha is best rendered, when not used absolutely, He removed himself, or kept, far, or aloof: and with Eano following it, it may be rendered he shunned, or avoided. ― -b4- tanaz~aha Eani Albawoli [He purified, or cleansed, himself from urine: a meaning assigned in the TA, art. nzh, by an evident mistranscription, to Astnzh]. (Msb in art. brA^: and a trad.) ― -b5- Also, He diverted, or recreated, himself; or took an airing; in the country, or in a garden. ― -b6- tanaz~aha meaning He went forth to the gardens (S, Msb, K) and [green fields, or] green plants, and meadows, (K,) is a mistake, (S, Msb, K,) accord. to some; but IKt holds it to be not so. (Msb)
nazihu Alxuluqi * [in copies of the K Alxaloqi] and ↓ nazohuhu and ↓ naAzihuhu [and ↓ naziyhuhu and nazihu Aln~afosi (see ZalifN)] Who abstains from that which is indecorous, &c. (K, TA.)
nazohN * see nazihu Alxalaqi.
naAzihN * see nazihu Alxuluqi.
naziyhN * : see naziha Alxuluqi. ― -b2- naziyhN A pious man; or one who abstains from unlawful things. (TA.)

1 nazaA EalaY AlA^unovaY *
He (a solid-hoofed, or cloven hoofed, animal, and a wild beast,) leaped the female; (S, &c.;) and so nazaA alone, elliptically. ― -b2- nazato Hanojazatuhu, said of a camel: see Eazafa.
1 nas~a * , aor. yunus~u, He went at a gentle pace. (TA, art. xbz.)

R. Q. 1 nasonasati Alr~iyHu *
The wind blew coldly: see R. Q. 1 in art. sn.

riyHN nasonaAsapN *
A cold wind: see sanosaAnapN.
nasiyjahN * , applied to a wind: see nay~iHap, art. nwH.

nisoEN *
A plaited thong, serving for the noserein of a camel, &c., and sometimes woven wide, [for a fore-girth,] placed on the breast of a camel. (KL, TA.) See also nisoEapN.

nisoEapN *
A kind of broad plaited fore-girth for a camel: pl. nisoEN and nisaEN and A^anosaAEN: (S:) or nisaEN and nusoEN and nusuwEN and A^anosaAEN are pls. of nisoEN, [a coll. gen. n.,] of which nisoEapN is the n. un. (K.) See EaZomu Alr~aHoli, in art. EZm. ― -b2- A^anosaAEu AlT~ariyqi (assumed tropical:) The furrows of the road, made by the beasts with their legs [or feet] in its surface. (TA, voce $arakN.)

minosagapN *
An instrument for pricking bread: see miroqmN.

1 nasafatohu Alr~iyHu * , (Mgh, Msb, TA,) aor.
nasifa , (TA,) inf. n. nasofN; (Msb, TA;) and ↓ Ainotasafatohu, (TA,) The wind carried it away; (TA;) i. q. *aratohu [q. v.]; (Mgh;) namely, dust. (Mgh, Msb.)
8 A_inotasafa see 1.

minosafN *
A vessel (wiEaA=') in which dates [and grain are shaken to remove the dust, &c. (TA in art. nfD.)

1 nasaka *
He worshipped: used transitively. See an ex. in a verse of El-Aashà, in the S, art. nSb. See 5.
4 A^anosaka * [app. He washed and purified a garment]. (TA voce A_ijotaAba.)

5 tanas~aka *
He devoted himself to religious exercises; applied himself to devotion; (S, Msb, K:) as also ↓ nasaka (S, K) and ↓ nasuka: (K:) or the last, he became a naAsik. (S.)
nasiykapN * : see EaqiyqapN.

manaAsiku AlHaj~i *
The religious rites and ceremonies of the pilgrimage: or the places where those rites and ceremonies are performed. (Msb.)
8 Ainotasala * said of camels' fur: see EaSiymN.
nasolaFA waA^asolFA * is a form of imprecation against a man, like taEosFA wanakosFA. (M, in art. Asl.)

nasolN *
Progeny, whether of man or beast. (The Lexicons passim.)

5 tanas~ama $ayoA^F *
He sought, or endeavoured to get. or attain, a thing, with labour and perseverance: i. q. taTal~abahu. (IbrD.) ― -b2- tanas~ama Alxayara He sought, searched, or inquired, for, or after, the news. or tidings; (MA, KL;) [as though endeavouring to scent it;] so that he elicited it. (TA.)
nsm mn AlTryq * , denoting nearness and shortness of the way. see nbq and musotaEojilapN.
nasamN * : see nasiymN.

nasamapN *
A soul; syn. nafosN, with sukoon: and nasamN souls; syn. nufuwsN. (Msb.) ― -b2- A man. (K.)

nasiymN *
A gentle wind; a gentle gale: a breeze. ― -b2- The commencement of any wind before it becomes strong: (AHn, M:) or a pleasant wind: (S:) or the breath of the wind: (Msb:) or the breath of the wind when weak; as also ↓ nasamN: or a wind from which comes a weak breath: pl. of both A^anosaAmN. (M.) ― -b3- baAridu Aln~asiymi (tropical:) One who chills people: see vaqiylN. ― -b4- nasiymN Odour, scent, sweet or disagreeable: see raAy^iHapN.

nayosamN *
i. q. nayosabN.

manosimN *
The sole (baATin) of the xuf~: or, to a camel, the same as the sunobuk to the horse; (Msb;) [i. e., the toe, or nail, or edge of the fore part of the foot, of a camel: see ZufurN:] the extremity of the xuf~ of the camel and ostrich and elephant, and of the solid hoof: or each of the two nails (ZuforAani) of the camel, that are upon [each of] his fore-feet: or it is, to a she-camel, like the Zufor to a man: (M:) or the xuf~ of the camel, (S, K,) and of the ostrich. (As, S.) ― -b2- [Also, (assumed tropical:) The toe of a human being: see a verse cited voce ja*aA, art. j*w.]

div2.head: nsw and nsY
div2.entryFree: 1 1a2V3a see 6.

6 tanaAsaAhu *
He pretended that he had forgotten it: (S, KL, * TA:) and (TA) he forgot it; (MA, KL, * TA;) like ↓ nasiyahu: (TA:) [or] he constrained himself to dismiss it from his mind. (MA.) ― -b2- tunuwsiYa It (a word or the like) was forgotten by degrees. (Occurring often in the larger Lexicons.)

Aln~asaA * [vulg. Eiroqu Aln~asaA, app. The sciatic vein;] the portion, in the thigh, of the vein (Eiroq) which, in the back, is called the watiyn, and which extends to the shank, where it is called the SaAfin: (IAth, TA, voce A^aboharu:) or the SAafin and Erq AlnsA are two branches of one Eiroq [or vein]: (Ibn-Seenà, vol. i. book iii. p. 608: [where the opening of each of these to let blood is mentioned:]) [in a solid-hoofed animal,] AlnsA is a vein (Eiroq) proceeding from the hip, or haunch, lying within each thigh, then passing by the hock, so as to reach the hoof: when the breast is fat, each of its thighs becomes cleft by two large portions of flesh, and the nsA runs between them, and is apparent. (S.) [In the present day it seems to be applied by some to the sciatic nerve: and Eiroqu Aln~asaA, as also AlnasaA alone, often signifies sciatica, or hip-gout: see niqorisN and also $anijN.
munosiyhaA * for manosiy^ihaA: see a verse cited voce EuqobapN.

1 na$afa AlmaA='a * , aor.
na$ifa , (Mgh, Msb,) inf. n. na$ofN, (Msb,) He took [or absorbed] the water from the ground, (Mgh, Msb,) or from a pool, (Mgh,) with a piece of rag or some other thing (Mgh, Msb) of a similar kind. (Msb.)

2 na$~afato *
She (a camel) [yielded frothy milk;] had nu$aAfap. (S in art. rgw. [See 2 in that art.])
4 A^ano$afa AlA^aroDa AlmaA='a * [It caused the earth to imbibe the water], said of the samuwm. (K voce A^aDoraba.)
mino$afapN * (pl. manaA$if) A drying-towel; napkin.
5 tana$~aqa see 10.
10 Aisotano$aqa Alr~iyHa * (assumed tropical:) [He snuffed the wind]: (TA, art. mxr:) he snuffed, scented, or smelt, the wind; as also ↓ tana$~aqahaA. (Msb.) See 10 in art. $m.

nu$aAqapN *
What is taken [or ladled out], while hot, from a cooking-pot. (TA.)

1 naSaEa *
He, or it, purified. (L.)

4 A^anaSafahu *
He did justice to him: (MA:) he acted equitably with him: (Msb:) he gave him, or obtained for him, his right, or due, from (mino) another: see A^aEo*ara. ― -b2- A_inoSAafN The giving what is right, or due: (M:) or the granting, or rendering, justice. (KL, PS.) ― -b3- A^anoSafahu mino ZaAlimihi [He exacted justice for him from his wronger]. (T voce Zal~ama.)

8 AinotaSafa minohu *
He exacted, or obtained, his right, or due, from him (M, K) completely, so that each of them became on a par with the other; (K;) [i. e. with equity]. ― -b2- AinotaSafa It became halved: (Msb:) [often said of the daytime (Aln~ahaAru)].
Tubixa EalaY Aln~iSofi * , and A^uSoliHa ElY AlnSf, It (wine) was boiled until half of it had gone, or evaporated. (TA, voce TaAbap.)

makaAnN naSafN bayona makaAnayoni * [A place half-way, midway, or equidistant, between two places]. (Mughnee in art. sawaA='N.) ― -b2- naSafN A middle-aged woman or man: (S, K:) or forty-five years old: or fifty years old. (K.) Dim. nuSyf.

naSiyfN *
A woman's muffler: see ximaArN.
nuSayofN * , dim. of naSafN: see xalayoqN voce xalaqN.

munaS~afN *
Expressed juice, (Mgh, Msb,) or wine, or beverage, (K,) cooked until half of it has gone [by evaporation]. (Mgh, Msb, K.)

manaASafN *
Not wholly ripe: [half-ripe:] applied to the date. (TA, voce busorN.)
A^anoSAafu All~abini * [Half-bricks, or] cut bricks, whereof the one is placed, in building, beside the whole brick, for the purpose of ornamentation. (Msb in art. xrj.)

naSolN * The iron head or blade (Mgh, K) of an arrow, (S, Mgh, K,) and of a spear, (S, K,) and of a sword, (S, Mgh, Msb, K,) and of a knife, (S, Msb,) and the like. (Msb.) ― -b2- naSolN The spun thread of the spindle: (K:) see surosuwrN.

liHoyapN naASilN *
A very white beard. (See AlEanoqaA'u Almugoribu, art. grb.) ― -b2- maA balilotu mino fulAanK biA^afowaqa naASilK: see bal~a and A^afowaqa in two places.
taSomapN * or naSamapN An idol: see SanamN.
5 tanaS~aY baniY fulAanK * : see ta*ar~aY.

naSiY~N *
A certain plant: (S, TA:) Golius says, a species of thistle; but this seems to be inconsistent with the description of it: see ray~ijapN. ― -b2- xaSiY~N naSiy~N Gelded, castrated. The second word is an imitative sequent.

naASiyapN * properly, in the language of the [classical] Arabs, The place where the hair grows in the fore part of the head: and hence, the hair of that part; the hair over the forehead; (Az, TA;) [and this is the general meaning;) i. q. quS~apN and Tur~apN. (Msb, art. qS.) The forelock of a horse. ― -b2- naASiyapu baniY fulAanK: see ta*ar~aY and *irowapN.

nuDaArN *
A tree of which yellow cups (A^aqodaAH) are made. (T, in TA, voce garabN.) See warosiY~N.

1 naDalahu *
He overcame him, or surpassed him, in shooting. (S, Msb, K.)

3 naADalahu *
He vied, competed, or contended for superiority, with him in shooting. (S, Msb, K.) ― -b2- naADalahu, inf. n. tinoSaAlN: see bay~anaha. ― -b3- naADal Eanohu (tropical:) He defended him, pleaded in defence of him, or repelled from him; (K, TA;) spoke in his defence, excusing him; (S, TA;) defended him, &c., as above; (S;) contended, or pleaded, in his defence; (TA;) defended him; and contended in his defence. (Msb.)

1 naDaA Alxayola *
He outstripped the other horses: see tajar~ada.

niDowN *
A lean, or emaciated, camel: fem. with p. (S, Msb, K.) niSowu safarK [Lean, or emaciated
by journeying]; applied to a beast. (TA, in rjE.)

5 tanaT~aEa * , (KL,) or tnT~E fiY AlkalAami, (S, K,) He went deeply, or far, in speech; (KL;) syn. taEam~aqa: (S, K:) was exorbitant, or extravagant, therein: (K:) or tnT~E signifies he spoke with the extremity of his fauces; [or with a guttural voice;] from Aln~iToEu signifying the upper gAr in the mouth. (IAth.)
AlHuruwfu Aln~iTaEiy~apu * and AlniToEiy~apu Dental letters: ee t.
naToEN * see niTaEN.
niToEN * see niTaEN.
naTaEN * see niTaEN.

niTaEN * and ↓ niToEN and naTaEN and naToEN A certain thing (Munjid of Kr, Mgh, Msb, K) that is spread [upon the ground to serve as a table for food, and for play at chess or the like, and to receive the head of a person when it is cut off], (Munjid, K,) made of leather; (Munjid, Mgh, Msb, K;) a piece of leather that is spread upon the ground for any of the purposes above mentioned. ― -b2- The anterior part of the palate; see gAr.

naT~aAEN *
A man who makes nuTuwE: and who binds books. (T, in TA, art. HT.)

naTafN *
Earrings: see a verse cited in art. sjd.

nuTofapN *
Sperma of a man (S, Msb, K) and of a woman. (Msb.)

naATifN *
A kind of sweetmeat; (Msb;) i. q. qub~ayoTaY. (S, Msb.)
1 naTaqa * trans. by means of b: see Ham, p. 75. ― -b2- naTaqa bihi means he pronounced it, or articulated it. ― -b3- naTaqa, said of a bird or any animal: see Bd, xxvii. 16.
3 naATaqahN * , inf. n. munaATaqapN, He talked, or discoursed, with him; syn. kaAlamahu, (TA,) followed by bi before the subject of talk, &c. (TA in art. frg.)

6 tanaATaqaA *
They two talked, or discoursed, each with the other; like taqAawalaA. (TA.)

10 AisotanoTaqahu *
He desired him to speak; (TA;) [interrogated him:] he spoke to him until, or so that, he spoke. (Msb.)
niTaAqN * The bar (mtrs) of a door. (TA, art. lz.) ― -b2- niTAaqu AljawozaA='i The Belt of Orion: see AljawozaA='u.

niTaAqapN *
A ticket of price, or weight: see biTaAqapN.

naATiqN * ― -b2- ATyAr nATqp Singing birds. ― -b3- naATiqN an epithet applied to A deenár. ― -b4- ja*orN naATiqN A rational root, in arithmetic; opposed to ja*orN A^aSam~u. (Mgh, art. j*r.) ― -b5- HayawaAnN naATiqN A rational animal.

manoTiqN *
Speech: (S:) Diction; or expression of ideas, or meanings, by voice and words. (K, TA.)

minoTaqapN *
I. q. HiyaASapN; (Msb;) A kind of girdle, zone, or waist-belt, which is fastened round the waist with a buckle or clasp; worn by men and by women; and when worn by wealthy women generally adorned with jewels, &c., and having also two plates of silver or gold, also generally jewelled, which clasp together. See A_iboziymN.

minoTiyqN *
Eloquent: (S, K:) or able in speech; an able speaker. (TA in art. fwh.)
AlHikomapu AlmanoTuwqu bihaA * : see HikomapN.
nayoTalN * : see sayoTalN.
naTomapN * : see naTobapN.
8 AinotaTati AlmafaAzahu * : see AntATt, in art. nwT.

niTaA='N *
Distance, or far extent; syn. buEodN. (TA.) See gaAy^ilN, in art. gwl.

naATiyapN *
A female weaver: pl. nawaATK. (TA in art. *rE.)
10 AisonanoZafa Al*~akara mina Albawoli * : see AstnqY.
1 naZama * [He pierced:] he pierced and knotted a cord or rope: and he (a xaw~aAS) pierced and plaited [the leaves of] the muqol. (M.) ― -b2- naZama He strung beads. (Msb.)

8 AinotaZamahu *
He transfixed, or transpierced, him; (M;) i. q. Aixotal~ahu. (S, M, K.) ― -b2- AinotaZama It (an affair [and language, &c.]) wa. or became, rightly [or regularly] ordered, arranged, or disposed. (Msb.)

naZomN *
What are strung, of pearls and beads, &c. (M.) ― -b2- Aln~aZomu: see AljawozaA='u.

niZaAmN * [A standard of a thing, by which to regulate or adjust it. See voce EiyAarN.] ― -b2- (tropical:) The cause, or means, of the subsistence, of anything; or its foundation, or support; syn. milaAkN: (M, K: *) a tropical meaning. (TA) ― -b3- (assumed tropical:) A way, course, mode, or manner, of acting or conduct or the like: custom, or habit. (M, K.) ― -b4- layosa liA^amorihi niZAamN (assumed tropical:) His affair has not a right tendency. (T.) And layosa liA^amorihimo niZaAmN (assumed tropical:) Their affair has not a right way, or method, of procedure, nor connexion, or coherence, (mutaEal~aq,) (M, TA,) nor right tendency. (TA.) And maA zaAla EalaY niZaAmK waAHidK (assumed tropical:) He ceased not to follow one custom, or manner of conduct. (M, TA.) And A^aHaAdiyvu lAa niZaAma lahaA (assumed tropical:) [Stories having no foundation, or no right tendency or tenour]. (M and K in art. sTr.)
naZ~aAmN * and ↓ niZ~iymN A composer of many verses, or of much poetry. (TA.)
niZ~iymN * : see naZ~aAmN.

1 naEaZa * , aor.
naEaZa , inf. n. naEoZN and nuEuwZN (S, Msb, K,) and naEaZN, (ISd, K,) It (the zub~, S, or *akar, Msb, K,) became erect, (S, Msb, K), by reason of carnal appetite; (Msb;) as also ↓ AnEZ. (M, TA.)

4 AnEZ * , (Msb, K,) inf. n. A_inoEaAZN, (S, Msb,) He (a man, Msb, K,) became affected with carnal appetite: (S, Msb, K:) and in like manner AnEZt, said of a woman. (Msb, K. *) ― -b2- His penis became extended. (M, in art. rwl.) ― -b3- AnEZt She (a beast) opened and contracted, alternately, her vulva; (S, K;) and so ↓ AntEZt. (AO, K.) ― -b4- See also 1. -A2- AnEZhu He caused it to become erect: (S:) or put it in motion: (Msb:) namely his zub~, (S,) or *akar. (Msb.)
8 A_inotaEaZa see 4.

HirN naEiZN *
A vulva excited by carnal appetite. (K.)

naAEuwZN *
That excites erection of the penis. (K.) $rb Aln~aAEuwZi [app. a mistranscription for $arobapu AlnAEwZ] Medicine which has that effect: mentioned by Z and Ibn-'Abbád. (TA.)

1 naEaqa bihimo A_ilaY AlfitonapK *
He hallooed them on to fight, etc.: see 10 in art. Ew.

naAEiqN *
One who drives away the beasts, and cries out after them. (TA in art. zEq.)
naAEiqaA='u * : see EaAniqaA='u.
1 naEVla see 4.
2 naE~ala see 4.
4 A^anoEalotu Alxuf~a * and ↓ naE~alotuhu I affixed a sole to the bottom of the xaf~ [i. e. boot]: and hence, A^anoEalotu Ald~aAb~aha and ↓ naEalotuhaA. (Msb.) See SiromN.
8 AinotaEalato ZilAalahaA * : see Zil~N.

naEolN * [A sandal: a sole:] the thing by which the foot is preserved, or protected, from the ground; (K;) syn. Hi*aA='N: and also applied to a taAsuwmap [or shoe]. (Msb.) What is now called taAsuwmap. (IAth, TA.) It often signifies only a sole: so in the S, K, Msb, &c., in art. xSf &c. ― -b2- The leathern shoe, or sandal, of a camel; which is attached by thongs, or straps, called saraAy^iH (pl. of sariyHapN) to the xadamap or plaited thong which surrounds the pastern: see sariyHapN and xadanapN. ― -b3- naEolN of a sword The iron, (Kr, S, K,) or silver, (S,) thing [or shoe] at the lower end of the scabbard. (Kr, S, K.) See gaA$iyapN, and 2 in art. frS. ― -b4- naEolN meaning A Har~ap, or hard rugged tract of land, &c.: see raHolN. ― -b5- naEolN (tropical:) A wife. See Eatabap.

niEaAliy~N *
One who takes care of the sandals or shoes [at the door of a bath or mosque]. (TA in art. vwb.)

naAEilN *
Wearing, or having on the feet, sandals.

1 naEima Eayo$uhua *
His life was, or became, plentiful and easy: (Msb:) was, or became, good, or pleasant. (Mgh.) See EawofN. ― -b2- naEima, aor.
naEuma , is like faDila, aor.
naEuma , and HaDira, aor
naEuma . See the latter. ― -b3- AinoEimo DabaAHFA, and Eimo SabAHFA: see tariba and SabaAHN. ― -b4- naEuma, inf. n. nuEuwmapN; (S, Msb;) and naEima; (S;) It was, or became, soft, or tender, (S, Msb,) to the feet. (Msb.)

2 naE~amahu * , (S, Msb, K,) and ↓ naAEamahu, (S, K,) He (God, S, Msb,) made him to enjoy, or lead, a plentiful, and a pleasant or an easy, and a soft, or delicate, state, or life; a state, or life, of ease and plenty. (S, Msb, K.) ― -b2- naE~amahu He nourished well him, or it; pampered him.
3 naAoEama see 2.

4 A^anoEama Ealayohi bi$aYo'iK *
He conferred, or bestowed, upon him a thing as a favour. See A^aHosana. ― -b2- A^anoEama Eajonahu He kneaded it well, thoroughly, or soundly. (TA, voce rayoEN.) ― -b3- A^anoEama Ald~aq~a He bruised or powdered finely: see daq~aqa. ― -b4- A^anoEama Taboxahu He cooked it well; syn. A^ajaAda Taboxahu. (IbrD.) The verb is often used in this sense. ― -b5- A^anoEama A@ll~`hu bika EayonFA: see A^abogaDa.

5 tanaE~ama *
he enjoyed, or led, an easy, a pleasant, a soft, or a delicate, life, with ampleness of the means of subsistence; a life of ease and plenty. (K.) ― -b2- tanaE~ama It (a tree) became flourishing and fresh, (TK, art. rwY, &c.,) luxuriant, succulent, sappy, soft, tender, and supple. See rawiYa. ― -b3- tanaE~ama i. q. tamat~aEa. (Msb. *)
nuEomN * contr. of buw^osN, (S,) [like ↓ naEomaA='u and ↓ nuEomaY and ↓ naEomapN and ↓ naEiymN:] pl. A^anoEumN. (S.) See niEomapN.

naEamo *
Even so; yes; yea. (Msb, &c.) See A^ajalo and bajalo.

naEamN *
Pasturing maAl [or cattle]; mostly applied to camels, and neat, and sheep and goats: or applied to all these, and to camels when alone, but neat and sheep or goats when alone are not thus termed; (Msb;) therefore, cattle, consisting of camels or neat or sheep or goats, or all these, or camels alone.

niEoma Alr~ajulu zayodN *
Excellent, or most excellent, or excellent above all, is the man, Zeyd; or [very or] superlatively good, &c. (Msb.) ― -b2- See by^osa.

naEomapN *
subst. of tanaE~umN (Msb, K) in the sense of taraf~upN subst. of tamat~uEo (Msb:) or i. q. ― -b2- tanaE~umN: (S: in F's smaller copy, tanaEiymN, an evident mistake:) i. e. plentifulness, and pleasantness or easiness, and softness or delicacy, of life: ease and plenty. ― -b3- naEomapN A living in [or rather enjoyment of a life of] softness, daintiness, or delicacy, and ease, comfort, or affluence: (KL:) i. q. ↓ naEiymN; (Msb;) and mutoEapN: (Jel in xliv. 26:) it is from Alt~anaE~umu; and ↓ niEomapN is from AlA_inoEaAmu. (Ksh, cited in Kull, p. 364.) See niEomapN: and see turofapN. ― -b4- naEomapu Al$~abAabi [The flourishing freshness, softness, tenderness, or blooming loveliness or graces, of youth. See EaboEabN.] ― -b5- naEomapN Softness; tenderness; bloom; or flourishing freshness (IbrD;) of a branch; and of youth, or youthfulness. (M, art. mld; &c.)

niEomapN * and ↓ nuEomaY and ↓ naEomaA='u A benefit; benefaction; favour; boon; or good: (S, Msb:) a blessing; [bounty; gratuity;] or what God bestows upon one: and so ↓ naEiymN: (S:) [grace of God:] and ↓ naEiymN and ↓ naEomapN, with fet-h, [and ↓ nuEomaY and ↓ naEomaA='u and ↓ nuEomN, ease and plenty,] enjoyment; (Msb;) [welfare; well being; weal:] ↓ nuEomaY and ↓ naEomaA='u are the contr. of buw^osaY and baA^osaA='u: (TA, art. bA^s:) baEoda Dar~aA='a ↓ naEomaA='u, in the Kur [xi. 13,] is like health after sickness; and richness, or competence, after want. (Bd.) ― -b2- niEomapN A blessing; (S;) a cause of happiness. (K.) A favour: a benefit; and the like. (S.) ― -b3- niEomapN Wealth, or property. (K.) The first explanations given to it above are assigned in the K, not to this word, but to ↓ naEiymN and ↓ nuEomaY. ― -b4- niEomapN with the article seems generally to signify Wealth: and without the article, A benefit, benefaction, favour, boon, or blessing.
nuEomapN * The act of rejoicing by a thing: and the state of rejoicing in a thing. (KL.)

nuEomaY *
contr. of buw^osaY; (S, TA in art. bA^s;) and naEomaA='u contr. of baA^asaA='u. (TA in that art.) ― -b2- See niEomapN.
naEomaA='u * : see niEomapN.

naEiymN *
Enjoyment; [delight; pleasure;] as also ↓ naEomapN, q. v.: (Msb:) plenty and ease. (K.) See niEomapN.

naEaAmapN * The blackness of night. (S in art. sqT.) see an ex. voce sqoTN. ― -b2- naEaAmapN The ostrich: it sometimes denotes the female. See maxozuwmN and jarAadN. ― -b3- $Aalato naEaAmatuhumo: see TaAy^irN, zaA^olN, $aAla, and a verse voce A_im~aA. ― -b4- Aibonu Aln~aEaAmapi The shank-bone: and a certain vein in the leg: and the middle, or beaten track, of the road: and the brisk, lively, or sprightly, horse: and the drawer of water (Als~aAniY) who is at the head of the well. (T in art. bnY.) ― -b5- naEaAmapN and naEaAmataAni of a well see zuronuwqN. ― -b6- Aln~aEaAy^imu Nine stars [of Sagittarius], behind Al$~awolapu, four in the Milky Way, [β, γ, δ, and ε,] called AlnEAy^mu AlwaAridapu, as though drinking; and four without the Milky Way β, γ, δ, ε,, [c, s, t, and f,] called AlnEAy^mu AlS~aAdirapu, as though returning from drinking; and the ninth, [ λ,] [not mentioned by some,] high between them: each of the two fours forming the corners of a quadrilateral figure. The twentieth Mansion of the Moon. (El- Kazweenee.)

Eayo$N naAEimN * [A plentiful and easy life. See naEima Eayo$uhu.] A pleasant life. (Mgh.) [A soft, or delicate, life.] ― -b2- naAEimN Soft, or tender: applied to a plant or tree: (Mgh:) [smooth; sleek. And i. q. mutan~iEamN.]
munaE~alN * , applied to a horse, white on the forelegs: see A^aqofazu.
A^anaAEiymu * , pl. pl. of naEamN: see a verse cited voce daAnaY.

1 naEaAhu *
He announced his death: see a verse cited voce TuwbaAlapN.
nugonugapN * : see gunodubap, and lugodN.

Aln~agaAniEu *
Certain portions of flesh by the uvula. (O in art. Elq.)

nagafaAtN *
Portions of dry mucus: see saliylapN.
nugaAqN * and nuEaAqN, of a crow, signify the same. (Lh in O, art. Ewq.)
nagilN * [in the CK nagolN] A hide vitiated, or rendered unsound, (S, K,) in the tanning. (K.)

A_ibonu nagiylapK *
The son of a female slave. (T in art. bnY.)

1 nagama * , aor.
nagima and
nagama , He spoke in a low, gentle, or soft, voice or tone: (S, Msb:) [he spoke in an undertone:] he used such a voice in singing: (K:) or he modulated his voice, or made melody, in singing. (TK.) See jrs.
2 tanogiymN * : see $iynN.
5 tanag~ama * : see jarasa.

nagomapN *
Gentle-toned speech; syn. jarosu AlkalAami: (Msb:) and sweetness of voice, or melody, in recitation [and in singing]. (S, Msb.) ― -b2- [Also, A musical sound, or note:] a melody: see TaroqN: sweet sound: pl. nagamaAtN. (KL.)
munaAgamapN * : see voce baA gamahu.

3 naAgaAhu *
He interchanged speech with him, each of them addressing the other with a word or saying: (TA:) nagayotu A_ilayohi nagoyapN signifies I addressed to him a word or saying: and AlmunaAgaApu signifies AlmuwaAjahapu. (JK.)

1 nafaEahu *
It profited him; availed him; was of use or benefit, or was useful or beneficial, to him. ― -b2- nafaEahu minohu: see an ex. voce jad~N. ― -b3- yanofaEu lika*aA, and mino ka*aA, It (a medicine) is good, beneficial, or profitable, as a remedy, for, or against, such a thing, meaning such a disease or the like.
2 naf~aEahu * , inf. n. tanofiyEN, He caused nafoE to come to him. (TA.)

8 AinotafaEa bihi *
He benefited or profited by it; made use of it; had the use of it; enjoyed it; like tamat~aEa bihi. See 10.

10 AisotanofaEahu *
He sought, or demanded, his profiting him, or being useful to him. (IAar, TA.) ― -b2- And AisotanafaEa sometimes occurs in the sense of ↓ AinotafaEa. (TA.)

nafoEN *
contr. of Dar~N: (TA:) or a thing whereof one makes use for the attainment of good: (B:) or good: or a means of attaining one's desire. (Msb.)
manofaEapN * [A cause, or means, of advantage, profit, utility; or benefit: and simply, advantage; profit, or profitableness; utility, use, usefulness; or benefit:] contr. of maDar~apN. (S, art. Dr.)

1 nafaqati Als~uwqu *
The marked became brisk, its goods selling much; syn. qaAmat. (K.) ― -b2- nafaqa It was, or became, saleable; easy, or ready, of sale; or in much demand: see its syn. raAja. ― -b3- nafaqato It (a commodity, siloEap,) was in much demand: and she (a woman) was demanded in marriage by many. (Msb.) ― -b4- nafiqati Ald~arAahimu, inf. n. nafaqN, The dirhems passed away, came to an end, or became spent or exhausted; syn. nafidat. (Msb.)

3 naAfaqa *
He played the hypocrite in religion: (K, TA:) he pretended, to the Muslims, that he held the religion of El-Islám, concealing in his heart another religion than El-Islám. (Msb.) And naAfaqa fulAanFA He acted with such a one hypocritically. (TK in art. dhn. [But I have not found this elsewhere.]) And naAfaqa fiY AlmaHab~api [He acted the hypocrite in respect of love]. (Har, p. 505.) See xaAna.

4 A^anofaqa *
He expended money: and he (God or a man) dispensed gifts.

5 tanaf~afati Aljazuwru * [The slaughtered camel became dealt out, or dispensed]. (S, K in art. $yT.) ― -b2- tanaf~aqa: see Har, p. 472. ― -b3- tanaf~aqa It (a wound) cracked in its sides, and made, in the flesh, what resembled ↓ A^anofaAq, i. e. holes in the ground, or subterranean excavations or habitations, pl. of nafaqN. (TA in art. dsm.)

nafaqN * : see sarabN ― -b2- A^anofaAqN The hole of rats or mice. (S, TA in art. xfY:) see 1 in that art.: holes in the ground; or subterranean excavations or habitations; pl. of nafaqN. (TA in art. dsm.) See 5. -A2- Also Fresh olive-oil: see faAqN in art. fwq: also mentioned in art. nfq in the TA.

nafaqapN *
What one expends, of money and the like, (K, TA,) upon himself and upon his family or household. (TA.)
nayofaqN * The part of a pair of drawers, or trousers, which is turned down at the top, and sewed, and through which the waistband, or string, passes. See nuqobap.
2 naf~alahu * , inf. n. tanofiylN, He gave him spoil, (S, Msb, * K,) and a free and disinterested gift. (Msb, K.) And it is doubly trans.: see 2 in art. gnm.

nafalN *
Trifolium melilatus indica of Linn.: and medicago intertexta of Linn. (Delile, nos. 706, 730.) ― -b2- nafalN: see ganiyamapN.
nufalN * : see tusaEN.

naAfilapN * : the pl. nawaAfilu, is explained in the TA, art. Hrz, by zawaAy^idu [Accessions, or additions]. ― -b2- What accedes to, or exceeds, the original. (T.) A voluntary gift, by way of alms, or as a good work: (T:) a gift: (K:) or a gift Eano yadK: (M:) a deed beyond what is incumbent, or obligatory. (M, K.) ― -b3- naAfilapN Supererogatory prayer. (S, Msb.) See taTaw~aEa.

1 nafaAhu *
He drove away, expelled, or banished, him, or it. (T, in TT.)

3 h`*aA yunaAfiYh`*aA *
This precludes the co-existence of this therewith; is inconsistent, or incompatible, with this.

8 AinotafaY *
It was negative: contr. of vabata and and wajaba. (IbrD.) ― -b2- AinotafaY mino $aYo'K He denied a thing; meaning an accusation or the like: syn. tanaD~aHa.

nufaAyapN *
Refuse; i. e. what one rejects, of a thing, because of its badness: (S:) or refuse little in quantity: (T:) or the remains, and bad portion,
of a thing: (M, K:) or, accord. to IAar, what is bad of wheat or food. (M.)

fiEolN manofiY~N *
A verb rendered negative by its being preceded by maA or the like; contr. of muvobatN and muwjabN. ― -b2- kalAamN manofiY~N A denied sentence; contr. of muvobatN and muwjabN; virtually the same as kalAamN naAfK a denying, or negative, sentence.

1 naqaEa * and ↓ AisotanoqaEa It (water) remained, or stagnated, or collected, in a hollow, or cavity: (Mgh:) or remained long, and became altered: (Msb:) or the former [and latter] collected in a manoqaE: (S:) or the latter [and former] became yellow and altered. (K.) ― -b2- naqaEa and ↓ A^anoqaEa [He macerated, steeped, or soaked, a medicine, in water,] he left it in water until its colour became changed. (Msb.)
4 A^anoqaEa see 1.
10 A_isotanoqaEa see 1.

naqiyEN *
An infusion; meaning, a beverage made by steeping something in water: (Msb:) and a mash.

sam~N naAqiEN *
Poison that takes effect; (S, K;) that kills: (TA:) that remains fixed, (Abu-nNasr, K, TA,) and collects. (Abu-Nasr, TA.)

A^anoqaEu *
More, or most, thirst-quenching: see an ex. under AlHaA*u, in art. Hw*; and another voce ra$afa.
A^anoquwEapN * The hollow, or depression, of variyd, (S, A, K,) in which the gravy collects. (A, K. *)
manoqaEu maA='i * , and maA='K ↓ masotanoqaEu, A place where water remains and collects; where it collects and stagnates; or where it remains long, and becomes altered. See naqaEa.

manoqaEu Alburomi *
Untwisted old thread which a woman spins a second time, and puts into the stone cooking-pots, because she has nothing but these [in which to deposit it]. (Sgh, K, TA. [From the K it would seem to be munoqEN alone: and in the CK, AlburAm is erroneously put for AlbirAm: Golius found it written AlbaraAm; and has wrongly explained it in his Appendix.]) ― -b2- sam~N munoqaEN Poison made into a confection. (S, K, TA.)
masotanoqaEN * : see manoqaEN.

mnoqaAfN *
A species of wadaE [or cowry]; (S, K *;) pl. manaAqifu; (TA in art. wdE: and thus in the M in art. dml: in the T in that art. manaAqiyf: see damaAlN.) See buwqN.

1 naqalahu *
He related it, told it, or mentioned it, from another; he transmitted it; he transcribed it. See 1 in art. HkY. naqala A_ilayohi HadiyvFA [He related to him a tradition]. (Msb.) ― -b2- naqalahu He transferred it; shifted it; translated it; conveyed it. He discerned it, or took and mentioned it, namely a word or phrase or signification, from (mn) such a one; he quoted it; i. e. naqalahu A_ilaY kitaAbihi mino kitaAbK A=xara he transferred it to his book from another book.

5 tanaq~ala biAln~uqoli * [and tnq~l alone] He ate nuqol. (MA.) ― -b2- Hence, tanaq~ala biAlHadiyvi He amused himself with talk; like as one amuses himself with the eating of fruit after a meal: see tafak~aha.

8 Ainotaqala *
He shifted, removed, or passed, from one place, or time (as in an instance in the K voce A^asowaEa), or state, to another.

naqolu AlA^aqodaAmi *
The shifting of the feet from place to place. ― -b2- baA='u Aln~afoli i. q. baA='u Alt~aEodiyapi The b that renders a verb trans.; as in *ahaba bihi. (Mughnee in art. bi.) ― -b3- Alt~aA='u liln~aqoli or AlhaA='u liln~aqoli means liln~aqoli mina AlwaSofiy~api A_ilaY AlAisomiy~api, i. e. The p that is added for the transference of a word from the category of epithets to that of substantives; as in xaliyfapN, accord. to some, and daAy^irapN.

nuqolN *
Dried and other fruits (such as nuts, almonds, raisins, dried figs, dried dates, &c.), [and comfits:] the fruit [that is an accompaniment] of wine; (MA in explanation of nuqolN [which is more common than naqolN];) fruit that is eaten with wine. (KL in explanation of nuiqolN.)

naqalN *
Stones with trees. (AZ and IKtt in TA, voce gadarN.)

manoqalapN *
i. q. maroHalapN (JK, Msb) mino marAaHili Als~afari. (JK.)

minoqalapN *
A thing upon which bricks are carried from place to place. (O, voce $abaHapN.)
munaq~ilapN * : A wound in the head, by which bone is removed: see $aj~apN.

Almanoquwlu * [Discerned knowledge; opposed to maEoquwlu]: under this term are comprised the sciences of A^uSuwlu Ald~iyni (also called Eilomu AlkAm). AlHadiyvu, and Alfiqohu: all the other sciences are comprised under the term AlmaEoquwlu; (IbrD;) i. e. intellectual, or perceived by the intellect; and excogitated.
A^anoqaliysN * [An eel] i. q. [Pers.] maAro maAhiY [and A^anokaliyso]. (En-Nadr, in TA, voce jir~iyvN.)

1 naqama Ealayohi *
He exacted vengeance upon him, punished him: see an ex. voce AbdY in art. bdw. See 8.

8 Ainotaqamotu minohu *
I took, or executed, vengeance on him, or inflicted penal retribution on him, for that which he had done: (JK:) or I punished him; (S, Msb, K;) as also minohu ↓ naqamotu, (Msb, K,) and Ealayhi, (TA,) aor.
naqima ; (Msb, K;) and naqimotu. (K.) ― -b2- See niqomapN.
niqomapN * [and ↓ AinotiqaAmN] Vengeance; or penal retribution. (JK.)

1 naqaha *
He recovered, but not completely, his health and strength: (TA:) or he became convalescent; or sound, or healthy; at the close of his disease: (S:) or sound, or healthy, but was yet weak. (K.) See bariy^a.
naqAahapN * [Convalescence;] the slight degree of health that immediately succeeds sickness. (TA, art. brA^.)

2 naq~aAhu *
He cleansed it; cleared it; picked it; purified it; removing from it what was bad. (Msb, &c.)

10 AisotanoqaY *
He took extraordinary pains, or the utmost pains, in cleansing his body. (Mgh.) You say also, AisotanoqaY Al*~akara mina Albawoli (K, art. brA^,) [He took extraordinary pains in cleansing the *akar from urine: or] he cleansed the *kr entirely from urine; syn. AisotanoZafahu. (TA in that art.) ― -b2- AisotinoqaA'N: see voce AisotaboraA^a.
niqoYN * The pith of canes, or reeds: see *ihonN. ― -b2- Somewhat of fat in a camel. (TA in art. TEm.) ― -b3- And Marrow; i. q. mux~N. (TA voce SuhaArapN.)

banaAtu Aln~aqaY * , or Aln~aqaA, The Hulakap [or Hulokap]; to which the fingers (banaAn) of virgins are likened:
(T in art. bnY:) a certain small reptile, that dwells in sand, resembling a fish, smooth, and having a mixture of whiteness and redness; called also $aHomapu Aln~aqaA. (TA.) See HulakapN and $aHomN. ― -b2- naqFA or naqFY An extended gibbous piece of sand. (S, * Msb, * K.)

nuqaAyapN *
The extract, or refuse, of a thing: see EuSaArapN.
munoqK * , said of a sheep, Becoming a little fat: see saAH~N. ― -b2- A sieve, syn. girobaAlN. (TA, art. dws.)

munaq~iyapN *
A woman who trims the split palmstalks in mat-making: see $aTaba and $aATibapN.
4 A^anokaza * : see munokidN and *am~apN.
manokizN * : see munokidN.
nikoEapN * , so written for nakaEapN or nukaEapN in the O and K, voce suwqapN, q. v., [The head of a plant.]

1 nakifa minaAl$~aYo'i * , aor.
nakafa ; inf. n. nakafN; and nakafa, aor.
nakufa ; and ↓ Astnkf; He abstained from, or refused to do, the thing, from disdain and pride. (Msb.)
5 tanak~afa bimawoDiEi ka*aA * [He waited, &c.,] i. q. talay~ava. (TA in art. Sqr, from the “ Nawádir. ”)
10 Aisotanokafa minohu * (KL, * MA) He disdained, or scorned, it; was ashamed of it. (KL, MA.) See 1.
nakafapN * : see gunodubapN, and lugodN.
1 nakila * , aor. yanokulu, see 1 in art. fDl.
Aln~ikolu * signifies A^al~a*iY yunokilu A^aqoraAnahu. (A, art. ED.) ― -b2- See nakalN.
nakalN * and ↓ nikolN: see badalN.

nakaAlN *
Any punishment serving to give warning to others than the sufferer: (M, K, TA:) or that restrains the offender from repeating the offence. (Bd, ii. 6.)
nakohapN * The odour of the mouth. (S, TA.)

1 nakiYa * , aor.
nakaYa , inf. n. nakaA='N, He (an enemy) was defeated, and overcome. (TA, art. nkA^.)

nikaAyapN * The inflicting injury upon an enemy: (MA, KL:) slaying and wounding among the enemy: (S, K:) or making much slaughter, (MA,) or a great, or vehement, slaughter or wounding, (Msb,) [i. e. the making havock,] among the enemy: (MA, Msb:) the inflicting a routing and overthrow among the enemy. (ISk, TA.)
niylajN * and niylanojN Indigo-pigment: see nuwuwrN, art. nwr.
nulokN * A kind of medlar-tree, Mespilus aronia. See ruwbapN.

1 nam~a *
He [uttered calumny: or] excited discord, or dissension, and made known discourse in a mischievous manner; or embellished speech with falsehood. (M, K.) You say, nam~a bihi and Ealayohi, inf. n. nam~N and namiymapN and namiymN, or this last is pl. of namiymapN, (M,) meaning, He calumniated him; or misrepresented him. ― -b2- nam~a AlHadiyva He made known, divulged, or told, conversation, in a malicious or mischievous manner, so as to occasion discord, dissension, or the like. (TA, art. qt; and Msb. *)

R. Q. 1 namonama *
He variegated a thing: he decorated or embellished it. (S, K.)
namiymapN * The sound of the bow-string. (Kr.) ― -b2- namiymapN Malicious and mischievous misrepresentation; calumny; slander; (S, K;) the embel-lishment of speech with falsehood. (Kr.)
namaAnimu * The sutures of the skull; as resembling lines of writing; see $aA^onN.
nam~aAmN * now commonly applied to Wild thyme, thymus serpyllum: see $abahaAnN.

naAm~apN *
The artery in the head: see A^aboharu.
munamonamN * A garment, or piece of cloth, figured with marks resembling writing, or otherwise. See ma*ab~arN.

A^anomaSu *
Having no eyebrows. (TA in art. vT.)
nam~aAgapN * The upper part of the head: and also the part that is in a state of commotion, of the yaA^ofuwx of a child, before it becomes hard. (L, TA.) See also yaA^ofuwxN.
2 nam~ala Alv~awoba * [He mended a garment] i. q. rafaA^ahu. (TA in art. lqT.)

5 tanam~ulN *
A formication or stinging, as of the torpedo fish: see “ Abdollatiphi Hist. Aeg. Comp., ” p. 82.

namolu sulayomaAna *
Red ants: see A^aHowaY, in art. Hw.

A^anomalapN * (thus generally written, Msb) The head [or end] of a finger; (S, Msb;) i. e. (Msb) the joint (mafoSil) (Az, Msb) in which is the nail: (Az, Msb, K:) [i. e. the ungual phalanx, with, or without, the flesh upon it: (see qaSabN:)] or a joint, or an articulation, (Euqodap) of the fingers. (Msb.)

1 namaY * , aor.
namiYa , inf. n. namaA='N, It increased; (M, K, Mgh, TA;) multiplied; became plentiful, or abundant; (Msb, TA;) said of a thing, (Msb,) of cattle, or wealth, (S, Mgh, TA,) &c. (TA.) ― -b2- namati AlA^aroDu The land throve, or yielded increase.

4 A^anomaY AlS~ayoda *
The quarry died out of sight of the sportsman: see A^aSomaY.

8 AinotamaY A_ilayohi *
He asserted his [own] relationship [of son] to him; (S, Msb, K;) like AiEotazaY. (S and Msb in art. Ezw.)

naAmiyapN * , of a grape-vine, The shoot upon which are the bunches of grapes: (M, K:) or the eye, or bud, that breaks open so as to disclose its leaves and its berries: (M:) or its branches: pl. nawaAmK. (T.)

R. Q. 1 nahonaha bihi *
He cried out to him, or at him, namely, a beast of prey, in order that he might forbear, refrain, or abstain. (TA.)

Aln~awaAhiqu *
The channels of the tears of a horse. (M in art. sm.)

1 nahika Al$~arAaba *
He consumed the beverage. (K.) ― -b2- nahiakahu Ald~ibAagu [The tan wore it, or eroded it], namely, a hide. (M and K, voce mufalofalN.) See mafalofalN.

8 Ainotahaka maHaArima A@ll~`hi * [He violated the sacred ordinances of God;] he did that which God had forbidden him to do. (Har, p. 18; where see more.) ― -b2- Ainotahaka Huromatahu He violated [his honour, &c.]. (MA.)

manohuwkN *
Affected with a constant, or chronic, pervading disease; or emaciated by disease, so as to be at the point of death. (S, K.) ― -b2- See mavoluwvN.

nahalN *
A fir t drinking: see EalalN.

manohalN *
A watering-place; i. e., a spring to which camels come to water. (S, Msb.)

1 nahima *
He had an inordinate desire or appetite (S, Msb, K) for food. (S, K.)

nhaiymN *
A chiding of camels. (TA.)

TariyqN nah~aAmN *
A road wherein is [heard] a chiding of camels: (TA:) see Han~aAnN.

1 nahaAhu Eanohu *
He forbade him it. ― -b2- laAtusohaY walaA tunohaY: see art. shY, in two places.
6 tanaAohaYa see 8.

8 AinotahaY Eanohu * , and ↓ tanaAhaY, He refrained, abstained, or desisted, from it, as forbidden; left, relinquished, or forsook it. (S, Msb.) See an ex. of the latter voce sawaAdN. ― -b2- AinotahaY A_ilayohi It ultimately reached, or extended, and sometimes it so pertained, to him, or it: in the latter sense said of authority and the like: and simply, it reached to him, or it. ― -b3- AinotahaY A_ilayohi Alxabaru, and ↓ tanaAhaY, The information, or news, reached him. (S.) ― -b4- AinotahaY A_ilaY mawoDiEK He came at last, or ultimately, to a place. So I have rendered it in explaining A^afoDaY. ― -b5- AinotahaY It (a thing, or an affair,) attained the utmost possible point, or degree. (Msb.) It (fruit, and the like) attained its utmost state of growth. ― -b6- AinotahaY It is ended: a word put to mark the end of a quotation.

rakiba Aln~ahoYa *
He did that which he was forbidden to do. (TA in art. rdE.)
nahuw~N * is anomalous, (TA,) like baguw~N.

nihaAyapN * The utmost possible point, or degree: (Msb:) and the ultimate point, or element, to which a thing can be reduced or resolved: its utmost point or particular: as also ↓ manotahFY. See faS~N. ― -b2- nihaAyapN fiY Als~axaA='i [Extreme in bounty, or munificence]. (O and K, voce masoHalN.)
naAhiyka biA^axiynaA * [A person sufficing thee is our brother]: the b is added to denote emphatic praise. (Fr in TA, art. bi.) See also Har, p. 28, and, more particularly, p. 91.

munotahFY *
A place to which a person or thing comes at last; a journey's end; a goal; a destination, or place or state to which a person or thing is appointed to come; an end; an ultimate object: see an ex. in a verse near the end of art. b. See nihaAyapN. ― -b2- sidorapu AlmunotahaY (Kur liii. 14) The lote-tree of the ultimate point of access, in the Seventh Heaven: see sdr.
AlguraAbu Aln~uwHiY~u * [The Noachian crow;] an appel-lation applied in Egypt to the zAg (or rook). (TA, art. zyg.)
Aln~awoTapu * The crop of a bird: see Aljir~iyoy^apu.
nw~ATp * The same as nuw~aAEapN. See ruj~aAHapN.
5 tanaw~aEa * , said of a branch of a tree: see tanaw~asa. ― -b2- tanaw~aEa It became of various sorts, or species. (Msb.)

nuw~aAEapN *
A child's swing, of rope. See ruj~aAHapN.

muniyfN *
High; lofty; applied to a mountain, and a building. (T.) You say also Eiz~N muniyfN [High nobility]. (K in art. EyT.)
2 naw~aqa * [He broke, or trained, a camel]. (TA, voce muSoEabN.)

5 tan~ayaqa fiY maToEamihi wamalobasihi * , and nanaw~aqa, He was nice and luxurious (tajaw~ada wabaAlaga) in his diet and his apparel. (JK, K.) Better explained voce taA^an~aqa. ― -b2- tanaw~aqa: see taA^an~aqa and tajaw~ada, and niyqapN.
niyqN * quasi-inf. n. of A^anaAqa.
naAqapN * : see qaluwSN, and baEiyrN, and bakorN. ― -b2- naAqapu AlHa*~aA='i: see riHaAlapN. ― -b3- A^ayonuqaAtN pl. of A^ayonuqN pl. of naAqapN: see a verse cited voce musohamN.

niyqapN * a subst. from tanaw~aqa The second consonant is unclear in the text. (IJ, S, K) as syn. with taA^an~aqa (S) [and therefore signifying Daintiness, nicety, exquisiteness, refinement, or scrupulous nicety and exactness; and the exceeding of what is usual in a thing: or the choosing what is excellent, or best, to be done, and doing admirably: or the doing firmly, solidly, soundly, or thoroughly, and skilfully: or] the exceeding what is usual in a thing, and making it good, or beautiful, and firm, solid, sound, or free from defect or imperfection. (Ham, p. 625) See taA^an~aqa.
1 naAla * , aor. yanaAlu, has for inf. ns. naAlN and manaAlN and manaAlapN. (TA.) ― -b2- See 6.

3 naAwalahu $ayoy^FA *
He gave him a thing; presented, or offered, it to him; gave him it with his hand; handed it to him; syn. EaATaAhu; (T;) he gave him a thing with his extended hand. (T, K.)
5 tanaw~ala EalyonaA bi$aYo'K yasiyrK * : see taTaw~ala.

6 tanaAwala maA='a AlHawoDi * [He reached, and drank of, the water of the drinking-trough]: said of a camel. (S, art. nw$.) ― -b2- tanaAwala mino yadihi $ayoy^FA He took from his hand a thing; took it with his hand from his (another's) hand; syn. taEaATaAhu. (T.) ― -b3- [tanaAwala $ayoy^FA He reached a thing; took it with his hand; handed it to himself;] he took a thing with the extended hand; (TK;) or simply he took a thing; took it with his hand, took hold of it; syn. A^axa*ahu: (K:) best rendered, he took, or reached, or reached and took, a thing, absolutely, or with the hand, or with the extended hand; and in like manner, with the mouth, as in an instance voce ram~a, &c.; he helped himself to it (i. e. food). ― -b4- tanaAwalahu biAls~ayofi He reached, or hit him, with the sword: see nafaHahu: and see ta$aAwaluwA, and A^aTaf~a. ― -b5- huwa qariybu AlmutanaAwali and saholu AlmatanaAwali [app. He is one from whom it is easy to take, or receive, gifts, &c.]. (TA.) ― -b6- tanaAwaluwA Alr~imaAHa: see 6 in art. *wq. ― -b7- tanaAwalahu bimaA yasuww^uhu [He carped at him by saying, or taxed or charged him with, that which would grieve him]. ― -b8- tnAwlh bmA layosa fiyhi [He carped at him by saying, or taxed or charged him with, what was not in him]. (TA, voce AigotaAbahu.) ― -b9- tanaAwalahu bilisaAnihi He carped at him with his tongue: (IbrD:) as also ↓ naAlahu. (TA, art. hlb.) ― -b10- tnAwl $ayoy^FA It (a noun, &c.) applied to a thing. ― -b11- tanaAwala It comprehended, or comprised: post-classical in this sense, but commonly used. (MF, TA.) ― -b12- tanaAwalahu bimaA yukurahu He taxed or charged him with, or accused him of a thing disliked, or hated. See also art. nyl; see an explanation of AigotaAbahu, and see ZahorN.
naAlN * : see nawaAlN.

nawaAlN * and ↓ naAy^ilN (S, K) and ↓ naAlN (K) A gift: (S, K:) and a benefit, or favour, obtained from a man. (TA.) See two exs. of the first voce xiroqN: and an ex. of the second voce EarabapN. ― -b2- nawaAlN is also used as an inf. n. See an ex., from El-Aashà, voce layosa.
naAy^ilN * : see nawaAlN.
minowaAlN * The web-beam of a loom; the beam on which the web is rolled, (S, Msb, in art. nwl, and S, K, voce Haf~apN,) as it is woven. (Msb.)

1 naAmato rijoluhu * (assumed tropical:) I. q. xadirato [His leg, or foot, became benumbed, or torpid]. (TA in art. bsr.) ― -b2- naAma (assumed tropical:) It (a woman's anklet) ceased to sound, by reason of the fulness of the leg: like as one says [in the contr. case], AstyqZ. (TA in art. yqZ.) ― -b3- naAma has for its inf. ns. nawomN and manaAmN. (Msb.) ― -b4- naAma Alv~awobu i. q. raqada [q. v.] (A, art. rqd.) ― -b5- naAmati Als~uwqu i. q. raqadat [q. v.] (Th, in TA, art. rqd.) ― -b6- naAma (tropical:) He lay; as opposed to he sat and he stood. See naAy^imN. ― -b7- naAma Eano HaAjatihi He cared not for the object of his want, neglected it. (Msb.)
2 naw~ama * and ↓ A^anaAma (assumed tropical:) It benumbed, or torpified: see naAmato rijoluhu.
3 naAwamotuhu fiY $iEaArK waAHidK * [I slept with him in one under-garment]. (S, art. $Er.)
4 A^anoAama see 2.

10 AisotanaAma A_ilyohi *
He trusted to him, and became quiet, or easy, in mind; relied upon him. (S, K.)

AimoraA^apN naw^uwmu AlD~uHaY *
i. q. raquwdu AlDHY [which see]. (A, art. rqd.)
naAy^imN * (tropical:) Lying; as opposed to sitting and standing. (Mgh.)
A^anowamu * [More, or most, prone to sleep]. (A, art. fhd.)

manaAmN *
Time of sleep. (Jel, xxxix. 43.) See also 1.
nawonapN * The dimple in the chin of a young child: (M, K:) see xunoEubapN, and qalotapN, and daAy^irapN, and 2 in art. dsm.

1 naAha bihi * (Msb) and bihi ↓ naw~aha (S, Mgh, Msb, K) He rendered famous (S, Mgh, Msb, K *) and magnified; (Msb;) and rendered notorious; (Mgh;) it, (S, Msb,) namely a person's name, (S,) or a thing, (Msb,) or him. (Mgh.)
2 naw~aha see 1.
1 nawaAhu * and ↓ AinotawaAhu He intended it, purposed it, designed it, aimed at it, proposed it to himself as the object of his aim.

8 AinotawaY Alqawomu manozilFA bimawoDiEi ka*aA * (S, Msb) The people, or party, repaired, or betook themselves, to, or towards, a place of alighting or abode, in such a place. (Msb.) See 1. ― -b2- AinotawaY It (a people, or company of men,) removed from country to country, or town to town. (TA.)

nawFY *
Date-stones: they are often used as food for camels; (see A_ibilN nawawiy~apN;) and for this purpose are bruised, and sometimes mixed with barley, and then moistened: see basiysapN. ― -b2- nawaApN What is cut off in the circumcision of a girl. (Lh, in TA, voce Eu*orapN.) The name shows that this is the prepuce of the clitoris, the end of which resembles the end of a date-stone. But see baZorN. ― -b3- Aln~awaY What remains of the place of circumcision of a girl after that operation; i. e. the baZor: (M:) or the place of circumcision of a girl, which is what remains of her baZor when the mutok has been cut off. (T.) ― -b4- nawFY Pieces of gold, each of the weight of five dirhems. (TA in art. jb.) ― -b5- nawFY The tract, or region towards which one goes (S) in journeying, whether near or distant; (S;) the place that is the object of a journey: (El-Kálee, TA:) [a traveller's destination:] the course, or direction, that one pursues (K, TA) in journeying and in acting or conduct: (TA:) see an ex. voce SarofN (third sentence), and Eaqara. It is of the fem. gender. (S.) See an ex. in some verses cited voce bayonN.
niY~N * and naY~N: see art. nyA^.

niy~apN *
An intention, an intent, a purpose, a design, an aim; a determination of the mind, or heart: (Msb, TA:) this is the general meaning: (Msb:) the direction that one takes (S, Msb, K) in a journey, (S, K,) near or distant, (S,) and in an action: (K:) the thing that one intends, or purposes, or aims at: an affair: (Msb:) the place to which one purposes journeying: (S in art. zl:) see an ex. from a rájiz in art. zl, first paragraph: the thing, or place, that one proposes to himself as the object of his aim, in an action, or a journey: or the thing, or place, that is the object of an action or journey: see Tiy~apN and $ul~apN. ― -b2- niy~apN naqaHN i. q. TaraHN and DrHN, &c. (O, art. DrH.) ― -b3- niy~apN baEiydapN: see baEydN, where the p of the latter word has been accidentally omitted. It also often (or generally) means A distant, or remote, thing, or place, that is the object of an action or journey: &c.

A^anaAmunotawK Eano ha*aA AlA^amori *
I. q. mataray~iEN, q. v. (TA in art. ryE.)
1 naAka AlmaTaru AlA^aroDa * , and Aln~uEaAsu Eayonahu: see nakaHa.

1 naAla minohu *
He defamed him. (L, art. qbH.) ― -b2- naAla mino EiroDihi He defamed him. (T, K, TA.) ― -b3- naAl minohu He harmed, hurt, or injured him, namely, an enemy. (Mgh.) ― -b4- naAlahu bilisaAnihi is coupled in the Msb, art. qrS, with A^a*aAhu; and seems plainly to signify A^aSAabahu, which, in this case, is the same as A^a*aAhu. And ↓ tanaAwalahu has a similar meaning. ― -b5- naAla He obtained, or attained. (S, K.) naAla mino Eaduw~ihi He attained [or obtained] the object of his aim, or desire, from his enemy. (Msb.) ― -b6- naAlahu, aor. yanaAlu, It reached him; came to him; syn. waSala A_ilayohi. (M, art. nyl.) See also Bd, xxii. 38. ― -b7- naAla laka A^ano nafoEala, aor. yaniylu; and laka ↓ A^anaAla: see A^anaY. ― -b8- naAlahu, first. pers. nilotahu, inf. n. nayolN, He obtained it; he attained it; namely, the object of his wish, &c. (S, K, Msb, &c.)
4 A^anoyala see 1.
6 humaA yatanaAyalaAni * and yatanaAwalAani signify the same. (TA.)

nayolN *
Obtainment; &c.: see 1.
A_inaAnapN * The act of giving: (PS in art. nyl;) the giving a gift. (KL.) It seems properly to belong to art. nwl.
nayolN * (T, M, K) and ↓ naAy^ilN (M, K) What one obtains, or acquires, (T, M, K,) of the bounty of another; like nawaAla. (T.)
See art. nlj.
